thread.title: Wilridge & Veal Named Preseason All-Sun Belt Conference Selections
thread.title_full: Wilridge & Veal Named Preseason All-Sun Belt Conference Selections

author: Steve Peloquin
title: Wilridge & Veal Named Preseason All-Sun Belt Conference Selections
text:
Wilridge & Veal Named Preseason All-Sun Belt Conference Selections By Steve Peloquin October 14, 2015 5:57 AM Photo Courtesy: ragincajuns.com 

Two members of Louisiana’s Ragin’ Cajun women’s basketball team, senior guards Keke Veal and Kia Wilridge, were recently named Preseason All-Sun Belt Conference Second Team selections by College Sports Madness. 
Aundrea Gamble of Arkansas St. was named Preseason Player of the Year, while her coach, Brian Boyer, was named Coach of the Year, and the Newcomer of the Year selection went to Madison Newby of Georgia St. 
View the complete College Sports Madness Sun Belt Preseason All-Conference Team here. 
Veal, a native of Opelousas, and a product of St. Thomas More High School, has led Louisiana in scoring in each of her three seasons, including last season, when she averaged 14.9 points-per-game. 
The 5-foot-6 Veal was a third team All-Sun Belt selection in 2014-2015, and was also named the Women’s Basketball Invitational (WBI) MVP after averaging a team-high 21.0 points and 5.8 rebounds per contest, helping lead the Cajuns to the 2015 WBI Championship. 
Wilridge, a native of Crowley, and also a product of St. Thomas More, averaged 12.3 points, while being arguably the best on the ball defender in the Sun Belt Conference. 
The 5-foot-5 Wilridge, who recorded over 100 steals last season, as also named a All-Sun Belt Third Team selection. 
The duo helped Louisiana to an overall record of 23-12 last season, including the Women’s Basketball Invitational title. 
The Cajuns open their 2015-16 regular season on November 15, when they travel to Oxford, Mississippi to take on Ole Miss.
